item.text: When all the Amorite kings on the west side of the Jordan and all the Canaanite kings along the seacoast heard how the Lord had dried up the water of the Jordan before the Israelites while they crossed, they lost their courage and could not even breathe for fear of the Israelites.
At that time the Lord told Joshua, “Make flint knives and circumcise the Israelites once again.”

So <st data-num="03091" class="">Joshua</st> <st data-num="06213" class="">made</st> <st data-num="06697" class="">flint</st> <st data-num="02719" class="">knives</st> and <st data-num="04135" class="">circumcised</st> the <st data-num="01121 03478">Israelites</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">at</st> the <st data-num="01389" class="">Hill</st> of the <st data-num="06190" class="">Foreskins</st>.<n id="1" />

<st data-num="02088" class="">This</st> is <st data-num="01697 0834">why</st> <st data-num="03091" class="">Joshua</st> had to <st data-num="04135" class="">circumcise</st> them: <st data-num="03605" class="">All</st> the <st data-num="05971 02145">men</st> <st data-num="03605 0582 04421">old enough to fight</st> when they <st data-num="03318" class="">left</st> <st data-num="04714" class="">Egypt</st> <st data-num="04191" class="">died</st> on the <st data-num="01870" class="">journey</st> through the <st data-num="04057" class="">wilderness</st> after they <st data-num="03318" class="">left</st> <st data-num="04714" class="">Egypt</st>.<n id="1" />

<st data-num="03588" class="">Now</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="05971" class="">men</st><n id="2" /> who <st data-num="03318" class="">left</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">were</st> <st data-num="04135" class="">circumcised</st>, but <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="05971" class="">sons</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="03209" class="">born</st> on the <st data-num="01870" class="">journey</st> through the <st data-num="04057" class="">wilderness</st> after they <st data-num="03318" class="">left</st> <st data-num="04714" class="">Egypt</st> were <st data-num="03808 04135">uncircumcised</st>.

Indeed, for 40 years the Israelites traveled through the wilderness until all the men old enough to fight when they left Egypt, the ones who had disobeyed the Lord, died off. For the Lord had sworn a solemn oath to them that he would not let them see the land he had sworn by oath to their ancestors to give them, a land rich in milk and honey.

He <st data-num="06965 08478">replaced</st> them with their <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st>,<n id="1" /> whom <st data-num="03091" class="">Joshua</st> <st data-num="04135" class="">circumcised</st>. They <st data-num="03588 01961">were</st> <st data-num="06189" class="">uncircumcised</st>; their fathers had <st data-num="03588 03808">not</st> <st data-num="04135" class="">circumcised</st> them along the <st data-num="01870" class="">way</st>.

<st data-num="01961 0834">When</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="01471" class="">men</st><n id="1" /> had been <st data-num="08552 04135">circumcised</st>, they <st data-num="03427" class="">stayed</st> <st data-num="08478" class="">there</st> in the <st data-num="04264" class="">camp</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">until</st> they had <st data-num="02421" class="">healed</st>.
The Lord said to Joshua, “Today I have taken away the disgrace of Egypt from you.” So that place is called Gilgal even to this day.
So the Israelites camped in Gilgal and celebrated the Passover in the evening of the fourteenth day of the month in the rift valley plains of Jericho.

They <st data-num="0398" class="">ate</st> some of the <st data-num="05669" class="">produce</st> of the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> the <st data-num="04283" class="">day after</st> the <st data-num="06453" class="">Passover</st>, including <st data-num="04682" class="">unleavened bread</st> and <st data-num="07033 06106 03117 02088">roasted grain</st>.<n id="1" />
The manna stopped appearing the day they ate some of the produce of the land; the Israelites never ate manna again. They ate from the produce of the land of Canaan that year.
When Joshua was near Jericho, he looked up and saw a man standing in front of him holding a drawn sword. Joshua approached him and asked him, “Are you on our side or allied with our enemies?”
He answered, “Truly I am the commander of the Lord’s army. Now I have arrived!” Joshua bowed down with his face to the ground and asked, “What does my master want to say to his servant?”
The commander of the Lord’s army answered Joshua, “Remove your sandals from your feet because the place where you stand is holy.” Joshua did so.
